title: Mario Mandzukic not training with his Juventus team-mates amid interest from Manchester United
text:
Juventus boss Maurizio Sarri has confirmed that Mario Mandzukic is not training with his team-mates as links with a January move to Manchester United continue to strengthen.

The 33-year-old striker has been heavily linked with a move to Old Trafford as United boss Ole Gunnar Solskjaer looks to bolster his attacking options, and noises coming out of the Juventus camp suggest the Croatia international won't be in Turin for much longer.

Former Chelsea boss Sarri told the media ahead of Juve's Serie A clash with Bologna that, due to an agreement between the club and player, Mandzukic is not training with the first team.

Juventus striker Mario Mandzukic is not training with team-mates due to an agreement

Manchester United have been monitoring the 33-year-old in a bid to bolster attacking options

'In this moment Mario Mandzukic is not training with the group due to an agreement he has with the club,' he said.

The news will come as a boost to Manchester United, whose attacking options have been blighted by a series of injuries.

Anthony Martial and Jesse Lingard are sidelined with injuries, while their leading striker Romelu Lukaku was sold to Inter in the summer.

Marcus Rashford has had to bear the brunt of the workload up front so far this season

Marcus Rashford has had to bear the brunt of the workload up top for Solskjaer's side, which has had a detrimental effect on his form. The United boss has admitted that he can't take the 21-year-old out of the firing line at the moment.

'At the moment we can't really give him a break because we've had injuries,' Solskjaer told Sky Sports pundit Gary Neville. 'Anthony [Martial] has been out for eight weeks now. So he's had to play loads more football than I'd hoped.

'Marcus is a centre forward who can play left, right and as a No 10. He wants to be able to play all the positions.'
